content.description:
A hard, bouldery start will test your stemming flexibility.  After fun, technical moves past the first 2 bolts, you come to a good rest stance.  Move left at the third bolt almost (but not quite) merging into

Bush Pilot

.  Clip the fourth bolt and move back right and up on the hand rail.  Hang on and fight the pump to the finish!
content.location:
This route starts just to the right of

Bush Pilot

in the large scoop.

climbs.name: The Other White Meat
climbs.fa: N. Beidleman, T Perkins, D. Ranck 2002

content.description: This is a short, steep, moderate route.  The crux is passing the fourth bolt.
content.protection: Five bolts, chain at the top.
content.location: It is on the right side of left-facing corner.

content.description:
This is a fun, challenging climb; it barely sees any action because most of the other climbs on the wall are far easier.

Start by scrambling up in the corner and reach way left to clip the first high bolt (or stick clip). Establish yourself on the face into a series of crimpy moves that increase in difficulty until you arrive at a very distinct crux above the 3rd bolt. After you figure out the crux, you are rewarded with fun, blocky, tension-y climbing through the scoop on amazing rock! The anchors are high up at cliff-top.
content.location: This is the first climb to the left of dihedral corner on the overhanging, scooped face.

content.description: This is an Indy Pass classic for the grade. It's on you from the moment you leave the ground. At the second clip, traverse right and then directly up on solid but spaced out holds. There is a hard to spot but bomber pin in the roof about eight feet up and slightly right of the second bolt. A second crux awaits at the last bolt.
content.protection:
Three bolts and one pin and a two bolt anchor with chains.

You can bring a few finger and hand-sized pieces for the flared lieback section above the roof before the last bolt, but it's so flared nothing fast and bomber is available - it is best to skip the gear and punch it to the last bolt and then get down to business.
content.location:
Around the corner and a bit uphill from

Bush Pilot

, find a decent flat dirt and rock platform. Climb the overhanging semi-gash to the first clip, and it's game on. The slightly right-leaning, 20' crack/rib feature above the roof is unmistakable.

content.description: This has an interesting/balancy start that follows the bolt line to the right up to the roof.  There is always a hold somewhere, you just have to find it.
content.location:
This is the route to right of the arete of "

The Other White Meat

."

content.description: Start on sidepulls in less-than-perfect rock.  Move up through some techy moves to a good jug shake at the fourth bolt.  Bust up making big moves to good holds over the bulge past the fifth bolt and to the anchors.
content.location: This is the furthest route right on Lower Bulldog.

content.description: Climb the steep arete on big jugs. It is super fun and pumpy.
content.location: This is the obvious line up the arete.
